name: Killarney Lodge

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights earlier this week. It's difficult to say anything which hasn't already been said. Catherine really is the perfect host - you are guaranteed a warm welcome. Good, spotlessly clean rooms, friendly staff, excellent breakfast, quiet location just a brief walk from the centre of town and off street parking. I think we shall be returning.
reviews.title: It is as good as everyone says

likes.liked: — Good sizes clean rooms and excellent breakfast

reviews.title: Our Family Loved Killarney Lodge
reviews.text: Our family, (2 Adults, 2 children, ages 10+ 4) stayed here in August for 2 nights. Despite constant rain we had a great visit. The logde is spotlessly clean, the breaklfasts were excellent, and Catherine was a wonderful host.. She was very kind and friendly towards the children. Another plus was the lodge ocation as it is so close to the restaurants and shops.
We would stay here again if in Killarney.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in 4 other B&Bs on our trip this was the best. Technically it is a lodge because the owners live in a separate building on the property. The rooms were very clean and very comfortable. The bathrooms were spotless. The house was beautiful and welcoming. The breakfast was SUPERB. So many choices...... Our host was kind and friendly. They offered free internet access on a communal computer. Unlike most B&Bs their price is per room not per head, and most rooms can comfortably sleep two couples. There was a nice fire going in the entrance way when we came in and our hostess was there to greet us. All the shops and restaurants in downtown Killarney are a 3 minute walk away. There was so much to do I felt like we didn't have enough time there. It is in a wonderful location to stay if you are exploring the Ring of Kerry and the hostess is more than happy to give recommendations. Killarney National Park is also a wonderful place to explore. I can not say enough about the Killarney Lodge and its owners. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.text: Lovely accomodation ,on quiet road , only a few minutes walk to main shopping/restaurants etc .
reviews.title: Really a lovely place

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and the excellent layout overall
likes.disliked: — Though quiet outside, it can be noisy inside with doors slamming loud due to attached springs. When you're sensitive to sounds and noises, this might be an issue.

reviews.text: I could not agree with the other reviewers, its is everything they said and more. If you are looking to stay in this area, do not look any further. The standards are very high, like staying in a 5* but you have the very personal attention of Catherine and her staff. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. It is so close to the town center, but so quiet and seconds from the National Park. It was a real find and will visit again as soon as we can.
reviews.title: Excellent, Excellent,Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a wonderful trip to Ireland. We stayed 2 nights in Killarney at Killarney Lodge and loved it! Catherine Treacy was a gracious hostess who made us feel very welcome and happily helped us with all questions on area attractions and directions. The hotel is in a very convenient location-a very short walk to the main street but slightly off so that traffic noise is not a problem. The breakfast was delicous and served in a quaint dining room. This room was large, very comfortable, and clean. We would definitely stay at Killarney Lodge again!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The location of the Killarney Lodge could not be better. Right in town but on a quiet street with private parking. Had not realized from the the previous reviews how close it was to the town centre. Its really just right across the street.
reviews.title: Great Location! Top Notch!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodations were top notch. Like a very nice hotel room. Our family shared a triple room with a queen sized bed and a twin. Very spacious and comfortable and clean. It seemed as though everything was brand new. Wish we had taken a picture before we had our stuff everywhere.
reviews.title: excellent place to stay

reviews.text: The host Catherine was very gracious, friendly and helpful in pointing us in the right direction for seeing the sites. We had great conversation about our college aged children.
reviews.title: Excellent place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying in a number of smaller B&Bs on our recent UK & Ireland trip, we found the larger scale of this establishment to be very refreshing. The rooms are large and are set up more like a hotel room than a room (as some B&B's tend to be) in someone's home. There are good amenities, off street parking and a large bathroom. Tea was served on arrival and on request as there are no tea making facilities in the room. The town is a only a short walk away and the staff were very helpful in terms of restaurant choices and sightseeing options. The breakfast was comprehensive with a buffet and cooked breakfasts avaliable. The approach of the staff was very professional.
reviews.title: Professional Hospitalty

likes.liked: — Location and professional attitude of staff

reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Killarney Lodge. The location was excellent for exploring Killarney (a touristy town with many good restaurants and pubs) – it was wonderful to park the car at night and walk into town for dinner. (I highly recommend Lord Kenmare's for dinner, the food was exceptional - some of the best we had on our trip).
reviews.title: Great Choice in Killarney!

reviews.text: Rooms comfortably appointed with a large television (with 10+ channels), bottled water, hairdryer and updated bathroom with a good shower.
reviews.title: Fabulous B & B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sitting lounge on the second floor had a computer with free internet access for guests and an ice maker.
reviews.title: Thumbs Way Up for Catherine & Her Lovely B&B!

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent – full menu of options (including Irish, cinnamon banana toast, waffles, etc) as well as a buffet with juice, cheese, scones, brown bread, fruit, yogurt, etc.
reviews.title: Killarney Lodge was the Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The south of Ireland was defo the highlight of our stay after spending 2 nite at the horrible Aerial House in Dublin. We stayed for 5 nights defo worth the money very clean very nice decor and very friendly staff. It was a 5 Min walk from the centre and heard no noise whatsoever. Will defo be going back
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: Beautiful National Park close by, great Pubs, late night shopping, great music.
reviews.title: We adored this lovely bed and breakfast!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hire a Bike while you are there in the park and visit Dingle as we did 2 c Dingle the dolphin.
reviews.title: 5 star b&b plus great location.

reviews.text: Staci x
reviews.title: This is where you want to stay!!!

likes.liked: — The charm, charactor, beauty and location cannot be beat.
likes.disliked: — There is nothing that I didn't like about it.

reviews.text: I never wanted to leave this wonderful place. The Lodge is absolutely beautiful. The location is great. Killarney Lodge is the perfect location to walk or ride bike through Killarney National Park to Ross Castle. (A Must) or walking into town. The breakfast is the best you will experience in Ireland and in the most beautiful dining room I've seen. They have free internet access at the Lodge which was very helpful. Don't just stay for one night if you can help it because Killarney is a nice town and the National Park is breathtaking. Catherine Treacy is the perfect host. If I could give Killarney Lodge more than 5 stars, I would.
reviews.title: terrific place to stay

likes.liked: — convenience to Killarney town, Killarney National Park, Ring of Kerry, Dingle peninsula

description: Killarney lodge is a large four star guesthouse conveniently located within walking distance of the Town Centre, Killarney Lakes and world renowned National Park. Owned and managed by the Treacy family, Killarney Lodge provides a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere which will make your stay truly memorable. Spacious air conditioned bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms, satellite TV, radio, hairdryer, and direct dial telephone and complimentary wireless internet access. Secure car parking is available on the grounds.
